Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> He didn't see the important of this, fought me on it, wasted so much time, and wasted others time trying to tell them I didn't know what I was saying. Fast forward a few days, and a Stanford paper comes out vindicating me 100%. But Pirate had already ostracized me, I wanted nothing to do with a team lead by somebody as inept at MrLynch

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Which is why I asked them to remove me from their website as a contributor, and left their Discord

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @gigamesh do not ask me these questions in private anymore, i am sick of it

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Additionally, he fought me on the ITM attack stuff, wasting time to the point of me questioning his actual motives and why he has the power and position he does, given that he can't seem to do any C++ full node coding worth a damn. In any case, everyone is free to run their own ship and my ship is Hush

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I realized doing free work, and being treated like garbage while trying to teach people the error of their ways, well, it doesn't pay well enough

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> That is why I will not contribute directly to Pirate any longer, even tho I have thousands of lines of code I could send

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> They know nobody uses their zaddrs, anyway

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Didn't even care enough to put out binaries yet

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> For Hush and  Pirate, this is actually a much bigger deal

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> KMD is doing a lot of testing, they have merged the entire 2.0.7-3 release into KMD and will release that soon, that is good

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> It won't be mandatory tho, and some (many) users will stay vulnerable until the next hardfork in December

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so, we could rush to do a meh job that almost nobody will update to anyway, or we can spend a little time making things more secure for the long term before we get locked into our next mandatory update

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> So I choose to think long-term

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am going to protect Hush against this IP-leak and the ITM attack as best I can, so that it's there before the next hardfork. I am developing this in a private repo and will release it when appropriate

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I don't know of any Pirate-specific development outside of KMD porting of ZEC code, I guess you can go to their discord if you want to know about that stuff

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> I am blissfully unaware of their issues/problems now, and it's great

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> indeed

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://twitter.com/dukeleto/status/1180490532251942919

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Just found this paper: https://lelantus.io/lelantus.pdf

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM you would probably like that ^

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Lelantus is a new protocol

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> by Zcoin and now being used by BEAM and other coins it seems

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> https://github.com/BeamMW/beam/wiki/Lelantus-MW

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> @ITM BEAM/GRIN/MW require an active malicious node to record history, their transaction graph is on their p2p network, but not recorded on the blockchain. This means ZEC+XMR coins are just easier to analyze, than MW coins, but a motivated attacker can still extract the transaction graph

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Lelantus-MW is to fix that

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> Because the tx graph is not easily accessible, it actually means only evil people that record the entire internet have access to it, average people don't and cannot go back in time to record the p2p network

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> so evil people have the data to do ITM-style attacks, but average people won't have sufficient data

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> "Only the worst evil people can reduce your privacy" unfortunately doesn't make me sleep better at night

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-hush] <dukeleto> which is why Lelantus-MW is some interesting stuff
